Description: Jar of coarse red siltware pottery, with a rounded base, slightly convex sides and a neck that narrows to the rim and is decorated with a medial ridge. The fabric contains traces of grit and there is a large limestone fragment embedded in the interior wall. The vessel is rather irregular and has the appearance of having been made using slow rotation.
Curator's comments: From Petrie's plate xxxiv, 19 and text (p. 66, 67 § 61), the item might come from Findspot 19, 25, 35, 51 as well as from the so-called "Camp". See also Boston, MFA 87.628 (from Findspot 25).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 61 § 58 (?), p. 64, 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiv, 19)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.94, fig.12, p.96, p.105, p.133, p.193, pl.35)
